text: Tha Pyay Kan () Village is a village in Kawa Township, Bago Region, Myanmar. Almost all of the people are Burmese. It has a primary school for education. It is located near the Bago river. There are two Buddhist monasteries: East Tha Pyay Kan Monastery () and West Buddhist Monastery (). As of the 2014 census data, the population of the village is 1039. http://www.openstreetmap.org ==Gallery== File:Aung A Date Htan Buddha Stupa.jpg|Stupa at East Buddhist Monastery File:Mu Lon Tha Pyay Kan.jpg|School of the village ==References== Category:Settlements in Myanmar
title: Tha Pyay Kan
